FirstRunMessage: Strategy Room is not ready. Please open the game once so we can get data. Also make sure following the instructions, that open the F12 devtools panel first before the Game Player shown.
ProfileFirstTimeHints:
Welcome to the KC3改 Strategy Room!
First-Time Hints:
  • More FAQs can be found in the Help Topics section at the top right corner of every page. ↑
  • If this is your first time here, you need to have played the game first with the devtools "KanColle" panel opened. See the Help Topics for more details.
  • If you only want to import your data backup, remember to close your game tab first.
  • If you want to export your ships or equipment to a single image, go to the Showcase tab and select the Export options at the top of the page.
  • Generally, if you need to reload or refresh the Strategy Room, it's enough to click on the
    ↖heart logo located at the top of the sidebar to the left. You don't need to use your browser's
    ⟳Reload this page button unless specified to do so.
  • This message can be dismissed by clicking on it once.
ProfileHelp1Q: The page is empty and an error message is on the top of page.
ProfileHelp1A:
You will need to play the game with the devtools "KanColle" panel opened. Use the gold heart extension icon on your Chrome browser's top right corner and select the option to play Kantai Collection. Activate the devtools panel with F12 or Ctrl+Shift+J.
With the devtools open, find and select the "Kancolle" tab from the top menu of the devtools. You may need to press the "»" button in order to find it. Remember to NOT let the game start until this panel has been activated. Once you're logged in to the DMM website, the game will proceed to start automatically.
This is the only way for KC3 to be able to detect your in-game data. Once the game master data is acquired, all of the Strategy Room tabs will become functional.
ProfileHelp2Q: Why are there no quest translations or subtitles in-game?
ProfileHelp2A: The options to turn these on are available on-screen after selecting to play Kantai Collection and BEFORE you press F12 or Ctrl+Shift+J in the instructions above.
ProfileHelp3A: The in-game admiral profile screen has its own algorithm for these stats.
ProfileHelp4Q: There's an option to clear profile data and an option to clear history. What's the difference?
ProfileHelp4A:
Profile data is data that can be read directly from the game: ship list, equipment list, fleet composition, quests, map gauges, etc. Clearing your profile data deletes information that can be easily replaced by moving through in-game menus, particularly the main screen and the quest menu.
History is data that KC3 has recorded over the course of your time playing while the viewer was active. It isn't data that can be acquired directly through in-game menus. Clearing your history will delete your records for all accounts that have played on this browser profile and cannot be recovered without a data backup.
ProfileHelp5Q: Does clearing data have any effect on my in-game data?
ProfileHelp5A: No. KC3 does not alter your in-game data in any way. Only the records and logs saved to your computer are modified by this viewer.
ProfileHelp6Q: How do I make sure my profile data is updated within the Strategy Room?
ProfileHelp6A:
Click on the heart logo located at the top of the sidebar to the left. You don't need to use your browser's
⟳ Reload this page button unless specified to do so.
ProfileHelp7Q: Can I export my history and profile data to another device?
ProfileHelp7A: Go to the Data Backup tab.
ProfileHelp8Q: How do I export my ship and equipment list to a single image?
ProfileHelp8A: Go to the Showcase tab and select the Export options at the top of the page.
ProfileHelp9Q: Why aren't the bug fixes working?
ProfileHelp9A: Close your game tab and other opened KC3 tabs first. Some data modifications require the game to be closed in order to avoid conflicts.

it won't be correct until next time you restart game with KC3 to get latest ship data.
ProfileBugFixDataLostWarning: Are you sure? Lost data would not be recovered.

Have you closed the game?
This fix won't work if you haven't closed all other KC3 tabs.
ProfileBugFixDbConfirmDialog:
Have you closed the game?
This fix won't work if you haven't closed the game.
Will begin to update your database in background,
DO NOT touch your browser until the 'done' or 'failure' pop-up.
ShowcaseHelp1A: Try to go back to home port in-game and refresh this page. It will fix itself.
ShowcaseHelp2A: You can use lightshot, gyazo, or puush or any preferred screenshot software.
ShowcaseHelp3Q: The top 6 here is different from the top 6 on Ship List!
ShowcaseHelp3A: Those are top 6 of the same levels. Unfortunately we will not go for the extra effort in further sorting them.
ShowcaseHelp4Q: What are the colors and digits under each ship?
ShowcaseHelp4A: Firepower, Torpedo, AA, Armor, and Luck. If it's a colored check, it's maxed. If it's a number, it is how far you are from maxing it. The exception is Luck which shows your current value but is colored.
ShowcaseHelp5Q: Why some of my equipment/ships are not shown on export image?
ShowcaseHelp5A: Image are showing only locked ships and items. If you acquired and locked item in current game session, you might need to go to home port once.
ShowcaseHelp6Q: Exporter is downloading image instead of opening it in new tab or Imgur!
ShowcaseHelp6A: In case of Imgur error or image data string is being too big for new tab to handle it will be downloaded.
ShowcaseHelp7Q: How does export event locking tags work?
ShowcaseHelp7A: If ship is locked in some operation you will see colored background behind it's name. If you only plan to lock it there you will see colored circle right after ship level. Please note colors on image doesn't necessarily match lock colors in game. You could compare them here.
ShowcaseExportShowNameLevelLabel: Show my name and level on image
LodgerLabel: Showing net material changes from %DATE1 to %DATE2
ShipListHelp1Q: Where is the heartlock, fuel, ammo, speed or marry column?
ShipListHelp1A: They are merged or hidden by default thank to the limitation of page width. Could be toggled by the C.Toggle button, or enabled by contents width auto-fit.
ShipListHelp2Q: Where are the ship types of XBB and AP?
ShipListHelp2A: They are not used by our shipgirls (AP taken by abyssal).
ShipListHelp3Q: Can I filter or sort by current HP or repair time of my shipgirls?
ShipListHelp3A: Not here, go to Docking page instead.
ShipListHelp4A:
Normally you can sort ships by levels, or sort by ship types so that ships of same type are grouped together. But this doesn't give you the ability to say "sort ship by their types, and under the same type, sort them by level.".

And sorting by multiple keys solves this problem: you can first sort ships by type to group them, then use ship level as the second key to sort under each type.

To use this function, select one column header you want to sort as usual. Once the first key is chosen, you can click "Start" to enable multiple key sorting, under this mode, each column header you click accumulates to, instead of replacing previous sorting method.

Suppose you want to sort ships by type, under the same type you want to sort by level, and if there are ships that have same type and level, you want to further sort them by morale. You can first click "Type" header, then toggle "Start" button to enable multiple key sorting. and then click "Level" and ":)" (Morale) in order. When toggling on "Start" button, you will see an extra line under it to indicate current sorting method. By performing actions above, you'll see "Type > Level > Morale", which does what you want. If you want some keys to be sorted in reversed order, just click on that header again.
ShipListHelp5Q: What does the color of ship name mean?
ShipListHelp5A:
Background color indicates which fleet she belongs to:Fleet #1 or Fleet #2 or Fleet #3 or Fleet #4.
Pink font means Level >= 100 (Married).
ShipListEquipExSpecTip:
Particular items not specified by type for ex-slot only,
for now some of Secondary Guns, Radars, Depth Charges, DLC, ETSCF, Boilers, Bulges, etc.
ConstructionHelp1A: Not persisted for now, but will be kept until next browser reloading.
ConstructionHelp2Q: Can I search resource values for a range?
ConstructionHelp2A: You can optionally add >, <, # or = before the value, which means greater than or equal to, less than or equal to, not equal to or equal to (default logic).
ConstructionHelp3Q: Can I do filtering by ship type?
ConstructionHelp3A: Nope, it's troublesome via only one select control matching by IDs. Feel free to enhance it if you would like to.
DevelopmentHelp1A: Not persisted for now, but will be kept until next browser reloading.

LargeShipConstrHelp3A: Nope, it's troublesome via only one select control matching by IDs. Feel free to enhance it if you would like to.

ArsenalHistoryDbFailure: Oops! Something was going wrong. See error logs for details.
DockingTimeHelp1A: This page lists all ships whose HP aren't full. Both docking time and time required for anchorage repair are shown.
DockingTimeHelp2Q: Why some ships are shown in different background color?
DockingTimeHelp2A: Docking ships and ships on expedition have different colors than others.
ExpcalcChangeGoalConfirm: Would you like to change your leveling goal for {0:name} (#{1:id}) to level {2}?
BlueprintsHelp1A: This page displays ships that require materials such as blueprints in order to be remodeled.
BlueprintsHelp2A: Grayed-out materials have already been used to remodel the ship in question and are therefore no longer required.
BlueprintsHelp3Q: Which ships should be given a higher remodel priority?
BlueprintsHelp3A:
This depends on your personal situation. To learn more, refer to these articles:
Ship Priority, Blueprint Priority, 改装優先順位
BlueprintsHelp4Q: What is the purpose of the All Ships view?
BlueprintsHelp4A:
The All Ships view displays all ships currently implemented in-game who require materials in order to be remodeled.
It also attempts to display grayed-out materials and total needs by considering ships that are already in your possession. In contrast to the Ships in Service view, several columns serve different purposes:
  • ID under the Ships in Service view corresponds to the ID assigned to your individual ships, but in All Ships view it is used to refer to the Master ID assigned to the ship's type. You can see these in the Ship Library. For example, your fleet may have two Abukuma Kai Nis - one may have her own ID of 573 while the other has an ID of 5957. However, the Master ID of the ship type known as "Abukuma Kai Ni" is always 200.
  • Level instead refers to the level required in order to remodel the ship in question.
  • The Requirements column additionally shows you the name of the ship's next form.
BlueprintsHelp5Q: Why does the data seem weird or incorrect following a game maintenance?
BlueprintsHelp5A: Sometimes the KanColle devs may either neglect to update the remodel data in a timely manner or they may put dummy data into the API result if multiple successive maintenances are scheduled. In order to fix such issues after the in-game data has stabilized, you can try refreshing our remodel info cache by clicking the 'Rebuild ship remodel information caches' link on the Profile page.
EquipmentListHelp1Q: Do you have a consolidated equipment list?
EquipmentListHelp2A: Currently category 41 is only used for Saiun (Disassembled for Transport), no longer available in game for now after Winter 2017 event.
AircraftListHelp1Q: What do the blue text in fighter stats mean?
AircraftListHelp1A: They are active squadrons equipped on a ship (or land-base). They have higher fighter power than usual because plane slot formula is applied.
AircraftListHelp2Q: What do those 'Unnamed Squadron' texts mean?
AircraftListHelp2A: You are able to input any text in those boxes to assign your aircraft squadrons with any name as you wish. They are just human readable identifiers for this page only, do not affect any in-game data. The numbers in tooltip are in-game identifiers.
AircraftListHelp3Q: Does this already involve fighter power proficiency bonus?
AkashiHelp1Q: What do the colored boxes and colored numbers mean?
AkashiHelp1A:
Red texts or equipment boxes mean you cannot execute this upgrade. It's either you do not have this item or item with these stars, or you do not have any of the required ships, insufficient resources, devmats, screws or related items to be consumed.
Yellow ones mean this item or the amount of items to be consumed you already have, but they are currently equipped or locked. To improve, you have to take them off from your ships or land bases; To upgrade, you have to unlock them.
AkashiHelp2Q: Why are some amounts question mark? why are some improvable items in game not here?
AkashiHelp2A:
Database for these items are not up to date yet, please wait for the results of verifying and updating.
Alternatively visit wiki pages or utility sites like: WhoCallsTheFleet Arsenal, Simplified Chart for Akashi.
AkashiHelp3Q: What are those green amounts in brackets?
AkashiHelp3A: They are amounts required to guarantee success.
AkashiHelp4Q: How to track and scroll to specific equipment item? How to remove the tracking?
AkashiHelp4A:
Redirecting from Equipment List or clicking an item icon with holding Alt key will keep tracking specified equipment.
To cancel the tracking, hold Alt key and click any DoW button.
AkashiHelp5Q: Why does the prerequisite checking not matched with my data in game?
AkashiHelp5A: Go to home port in game once, then click on Heart Logo to refresh with latest data.
AkashiHelp6Q: Why does the DoW selected by default sometime not match with today?
AkashiHelp6A:
Because it's current day of week in Japan standard timezone, not yours.
Either make sure your computer's clock gets synced if there is off a bit.
FleetManagerHelp1Q: Why does "Current Fleets" not matched with the fleets in game?
FleetManagerHelp1A: Go to home port in game once, then click on Heart Logo to refresh with latest data.
FleetManagerHelp2Q: Why eLoS or fighter power looks different? Gear improvement and plane proficiency disappeared?
FleetManagerHelp2A: Because these data, such as gear improvement and plane proficiency, are not saved to old sortie history record. They are not able to completely be reproduced when import from old history. Furthermore, as your HQ level also not saved aside, value of eLoS Formula 33 might be affected by your current HQ level.
FleetManagerHelp3Q: Why support power is 0 or quite few?
FleetManagerHelp3A: Because ships' fire and torpedo power with equipments are not saved to sortie history. Support power is not able to be reproduced when import from history, although some fixed powers are given to CV(L).

QuestFlowchartYearlyPrompt:
Which option would you like to choose?
OK: Reset all yearly quests

QuestFlowchartAllPrompt:
Are you sure?
All your quest data will be cleared, including 1-time quests you have done. Lost data would not be recovered.
ShipQuestsPageTitle: List of ships required by quests
ShipQuestsHelp1A: This page shows player's ships with all associated quests except limited-time ones.
ShipQuestsHelp2A:
Suppose, you have some ships, which you don't need anymore, but can be required for some one-time quests.
Just go to this page and see which ships required for what quests.
ShipQuestsHelp3A: Because quests are identified by in-game API ID numbers, and game developers often assign the ID of out-dated limited-time quest to a new quest. Required ships might be different, old info unreliable.

Heavy Air Raid Interception result: {0}

ShipDropHelp1Q: Are these records from a data collecting cloud service?
ShipDropHelp1A:
Nope. These drops are from recorded sortie history data of your own, if you have enabled the history recording.
It's just an alternative view of Maps / Events History pages, no remote data from any report server have been fetched.
It's expected that unable to determine boss node from 'ancient' history or events data.
Will be a little weird if node letters are not ready or your history data have been partially corrupted.
ShipDropHelp2Q: Will some ship types listed here drop?
ShipDropHelp2A:
Nope. All available ship types are just copied from Ship List page.
To activate only 1 filter quickly instead of switching, like doing it on the Ship List page, you can hold Alt key and left click one of them.
ShipDropHelpMore:
Online statistics services: poi-statistics
TsunDB
ExpedPastHelp1A:
Monthly Expedition: blue name, can be succeeded once every month, reset at 12:00 JST on the 15th;
Combat Expedition: red time, your fleet may take damage from enemy.
btw, expedition name with * mark means sortie support expedition which cannot be cancelled.
ExpedPastHelp2A:
Holding Alt key and clicking on a checkbox of expedition or fleet, will check the selected item only instead of toggling it.

Clicking on any ship icon of result list will show the fleet in Fleet Manager. Holding Ctrl or Meta key will open Fleet Manager in new tab.
